data.title: On the Complete Description of Entangled SystemsPart II: The (Meta)Physical Status and Semantic Aspects
data.meta_description: We review some semantical aspects of probability bounds from Boole’s “conditions on possible experience” violated by quantum mechanics. We also speculate about emerging space-time categories as an epiphenomenon of quantization and the resulting breakdown of relativity theory by non-unitary and non-linear processes.
data.text:
Version 1 : Received: 6 November 2022 / Approved: 9 November 2022 / Online: 9 November 2022 (01:49:04 CET)

Abstract

We review some semantical aspects of probability bounds from Boole’s “conditions on possible experience” violated by quantum mechanics. We also speculate about emerging space-time categories as an epiphenomenon of quantization and the resulting breakdown of relativity theory by non-unitary and non-linear processes.

Keywords

communication cost; simulating quantum correlations; contextuality

Subject

Physical Sciences, Quantum Science and Technology
